page.title: 17THE VILLAGE HALL PRIVETT
page.content: At the Bailey Green cross-roads stands the Village Hall, a simple single storey building, the centre for social events. There is a strong community spirit among the young people, who organise the Summer fete, the Harvest supper, the Christmas party, barbecues and dancing to a discotheque. Since the closure of the Church a service of Holy Communion is held monthly in the Village Hall, followed by Family Service which the children attend. These are conducted by the Vicar from Hawkley. There is at present no W.I. in the village, but several young women attend meetings of the Housewives' Register, held usually in members' homes.
